intro: Halimocnemis macranthera, commonly known as the broad-fruited sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a low-growing perennial herb with succulent stems and fleshy, linear leaves adapted to conserve water. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in spring. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to thrive in sandy or gravelly soils. Halimocnemis macranthera plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates in its native environment.
